Conscientious Monk [jakobi] has sent me some private messages recently regarding [Tutorials]. In particular, he seems to feel that some clarifying/introductory content could be added to [id://519394]; see [pad://jakobi]. I think I've seen him trying to discuss this publicly in the cb as well. I have to confess, I have a hard time making heads or tails out of what he's trying to propose, but I get the sense it is fairly radical relative to the existing infrastructure and policy framework. Does anybody else have a better idea of what he wants, and so can shepherd him toward an improvement which fits within the PerlMonks [wp://M.O.]? TIA...

I told him that [id://519394] is just a list of links to other nodes, and so does not contain actual tutorial material itself. He went looking for an explanation of [tutlist] and found none. (And indeed, anything which might be edifying is "tough beans" for him.)
So I'm wondering if maybe we need a sitefaqlet explaining the infrastructure of [Tutorials] in laymonks' terms.

Btw... [tye] has made it pretty clear that he does not condone changing the section (i.e. the nodetype) of a node after it has resided in a certain section for a long time. He says that if a node is to be moved, it should be done within a very short window after initial posting, due to things like an error in section selection on the part of the poster.

Given that, Option #1, below, is essentially not an option, for this task.

[jdporter], [localtime://2009-01-27 16:40:33]

So, I'm going through [Tutorials], trying to eliminate the non-tutorial nodes linked there (ignoring tutlists and tutstrings, of course).
For background, see my post - [id://739048], which is based on [href://?node_id=322009#2007-06-28 12:11:28|this Cabalists' Wiki entry].

In general, when a non-tutorial node is found in [Tutorials], the decision is among the following courses of action:

  1. Have the [gods]/[janitors] convert it to the tutorial nodetype;
  2. Unlink it from [Tutorials] (and, if appropriate, linking it somewhere else so it isn't lost);
  3. Leave it be, and live with the horror of having non-tutorial nodes in [Tutorials].

Furthermore, if Option 2 is chosen, there is the additional possible action of replacing the removed meditation with an equivalent tutorial. We'd probably want this if the node is of sufficient quality and tutorial character. This entails a decision point:

  1. Have the author of the meditation post the replacement tutorial;
  2. Have one of us post it.

This will generally come down to whether the author is still active on PerlMonks or not; but it could also happen that the author is active but refuses, for one reason or another, to re-post the med as a tut.

As a mostly orthogonal decision to the above, we'd want to consider whether any node in [Tutorials] (of any node type — tutorial, meditation, or whatever) should be taken from its original author and ownership given to [Pedagogues|us]. I think, in general, this is only warranted when the original author is "gone for good" and we have some reason to need to modify the node.

Now, having said all that.... I would like your opinion on the following: There is a certain tutlist, [id://519396], which contains all of the "Perl Idioms Explained" posts. These posts are all meditations except one, a tutorial. I, personally, would be happy to unlink them from [Tutorials] and forget about them. However, having the one tutorial complicates this course of action. I could (and am planning to) ask the [gods] to convert that one tutorial into a meditation, to make it consistent with the others; but I anticipate that this could be a tough sell. My feeling is that we should not be obliged to retain an index to any arbitrary series of useful meditations (see [id://622396]). On the other hand, if concensus turns out to be to keep that list as it stands, then I will, naturally, argue that the meditations in it should be converted to tutorials. What are your thoughts?
